basic_info.description: My name is Vitaliy Vekslyer. I'm building projects with the newest and most exciting technologies such as Machine Learning and Brain Computer Interfaces. This is my portfolio website built with React. I have recently graduated from Computing Science at Douglas College and am currently looking for work as a developer. Feel free to contact me through my LinkedIn. I am always looking for new projects to work on and to gain experience from. :)

projects.title: Brain Computer Interface for Unity & PyGame
projects.description:
I used OpenBCI's API and Machine Learning to control games made in Unity and PyGame.
 • Used OpenBCI API and neuromore to allow user to control a car game in Unity.
 • Implemented a machine learning inspired perceptron model to understand when user wishes to move the car forward.
 • Achieved 98% accuracy of user's intention to move the car.
 • Currently working on allowing user to control pong game using PyGame & TensorFlow.

projects.title: Asteroid Blaster
projects.description:
Asteroids clone made with C++ SDL. I wanted to know how games in C++ as well as GUIs are really being made and I came across SDL which I learnt a lot about while making this and a few other simple games.
 • Made using object-oriented principles.
 • Used knowledge of physics, algebra, trigonometry to implement simple 2D sprite movement.

projects.title: Exercise Journal
projects.description: The biggest collaborative project I had with seven other student developers. I delegated tasks using Agile PM principles and had worked closely with the frontend of the app with authentication of new users through the welcome screen.
